attributes.action: Continue the mandatory wearing mask in public indoor places beyond 19th July
attributes.additional_details: Face masks are an effect way of slowing the spread of the coronavirus without an impact on people’s sizeable impact lives or livelihoods. To get rid of the implementation of the masks may lead to a rise in cases, hospitalisation. Although it may seem like freedom for most of us, it will mean the opposite for the many vulnerable people in our country.
attributes.background: Keep the enforcement of face masks or coverings in Public indoor places (eg. Shops and restaurants) as well as Public transport.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep face covering mandatory in indoor public settings beyond 19th July 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590616

Keep mandatory face coverings in supermarkets and on public transport: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590836
 
Keep face masks mandatory for public transport after the lifting of restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590694

Keep requirement to wear a face covering in shops & supermarkets after July 19th: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590829
